options.content: Started on time, all materials present
Started late, some materials missing
Followed script, format or plan of written program
Followed format/script/lesson plan in written program, but was not fluent
Followed portions format/script/lesson plan in written program
Did not follow format/script/lesson plan
Correct signal sequence included 90% or more of the time
Correct signal sequence included 70% - 89% of the time
Correct signal sequence included less than 69% of the time
Frequent eye contact and frequent scanning of group
Some eye contact and/or infrequent scanning of group
Little or not eye contact and/or not scanning of group
Consistently included opportunities to respond and relevant combinations of individual/group/dispersed turns
Inconsistently included opportunities to respond, and/or lacks relevant combinations of individual/group/dispersed turns
Inadequate opportunities to respond, lacks relevant combinations of individual/group/dispersed turns

rows.tooltip:
3 Components of Quality Error Correction
1. Model
2. Test
3. Delayed Test

options.content: All components present 90% or more of the time
One or more components present 70-89% of the time; all components must be 70% or greater
One or more components present less than 70% of the time
Efficient use of time and progresses through lesson appropriately, efficient transitions
Partially efficient use of time and/or progresses through parts of lesson appropriately, some efficient transitions
Inefficient use of time and/or does not progress through lesson appropriately, inefficient transitions
Appropriate enthusiasm, tone, and volume, relates positive attitude, age appropriate, consistently uses smooth phrasing and emphasizes key words
Little/excessive enthusiasm, tone, and volume, interferes with student learning/behavior, generally uses smooth phrasing and generally emphasizes key words
Little or no enthusiasm, tone, and volume, interferes with student learning/behavior, does not use smooth phrasing, no emphasis of key words
Positively stated at beginning of lesson, and provides necessary directions to start lesson, find page, get supplies, etc.
Negatively states or does not state behavior expectations
Consistently follows classroom management plan to address appropriate and problem behaviors
Consistently follows classroom management plan to address appropriate and problem behaviors, some or most of the time
Inconsistently follows classroom management plan to address appropriate and problem behaviors
Does not follow classroom management plan
Praise/redirect ratio at least 3:1; praise rate appropriate for group/individual
Praise/redirect ratio of at least 2:1
Praise/redirect ratio less than 2:1

rows.tooltip:
4 Components of Quality Reinforcement
1. Varied (academic & behavior)
2. Contingent
3. Descriptive
4. Non-disruptive

options.content: All 4 components observed
2-3 Components observed
0-1 components observed
Data recorded accurately and aligned to objective, information on data sheet complete
No data recorded or recorded inaccurately, data recorded does not align to the objective
Records indicate data has been recorded previously with a minimum of 5 data points, form is neat and legible
No records of data recorded previously, form not legible or easily understood
Appropriate instructional/behavior management decisions made and based on recorded data and objective
Instructional/behavior management decisions made subjectively, but not based on recorded data
Inappropriate instructional/behavior management decisions made
Able to articulate trends in data and identify need to change and appropriate actions to take
With support articulates trends in data and identify need to change and appropriate actions to take
Does not sufficiently articulate trends, needs, and actions to take

tooltip: Refer to USU Department of Special Education and Rehabilitation Professional Guidelines

rows.tooltip:
1. Dresses modestly in clean clothes in good repair
2. Dresses consistent with the dress of teachers and administrators in the school
3. Maintains good personal hygiene

options.content: Dresses appropriately and maintains good personal hygiene
Doess not dress appropriately and/or does not maintain personal hygiene

rows.tooltip:
1. Accepts feedback and constructive criticism
2. Acknowledges need for improvement,
3. Asks questions for clarification,
4. Immediately implements recommended changes

options.content: Responds appropriately to constructive criticism
Does not respond appropriately to constructive criticism

rows.tooltip:
1. Implements changes in behavior, procedure, or schedule as recommended
2. Checks with person who provided feedback to receive input on whether implementation is correct

options.content: Correctly implements changes after being given feedback
Does not correctly implement changes after being given feedback

rows.tooltip:
Exhibits appropriate verbal and nonverbal communication
(i.e., tone of voice, facial expression, gestures, etc.)
when interacting with teachers, classroom staff, and students.

options.content: Exhibits positive and respectful attitude in the classroom
Does not exhibit positive and respectful attitude in the classroom

rows.tooltip:
Effective team member, appropriate levels of independence, constructive verbal messages,
listen to and understands feedback, self/social awareness, self/relationship management,
accepts responsibility, self-control, expresses self appropriately, generalized information

options.content: Demonstrates many or all professional attributes
Does not demonstrate or only sometimes demonstrates professional attributes
